name: Summertime honkin' big banana yarn
description:
Gorgeous shiny beautiful big and honking hanks. The yarn is 100% recycled banana fiber which gives it a beautiful drapey shine. 

200 grams, 150 yards, worsted weight

We are a small farm in rural Maine. I was able to bring my love of animals and fiber together. Most of the animals are rescues. I've found them thru word of mouth and ads. I work with my local shelters to provide foster and permanent homes for these animals. My philosophy is "We have engineered many of our domesticated species that they cannot live without us, therefore we are responsible for them."

I will do custom orders of fiber blends and colors. I am also willing to spin your favorite colorway for you. Just Ask!

name: Spinning Fiber Silk Blanks
description:
This silk blank is dyed in dusky purples, aqua blue and peachy yellow. The spinning fiber is dyed so that there will be short color changes and it will be a variegated yarn. Go ahead spin your rainbow!

If you have any questions on how to spin silk blanks check out this tutorial or feel free to email me at brandischoch@thefiberofmybeing.net
 http://www.thefiberofmybeing.net/2012/10/spinning-silk-blanks/


This fiber is 100% silk. I find it fine to gently handwash silk items(as this is how I set the twist in the yarn) but you can always dry clean or dryel your finished object if you prefer.

name: Superwash Spinning Fiber in light colors
description:
4oz of squishy, smushy, soft superwash spinning fiber in wispy reds, greens, and white.

This is superwash fiber it will not felt. This means that it can go into the washer and dryer. I usually wash on gentle and tumble dry on the lower heat setting just as a precaution. Superwash is good for a variety of projects from sweaters to afghans.

We are a small farm in rural Maine. I was able to bring my love of animals and fiber together. Most of the animals are rescues. I've found them thru word of mouth and ads. name: Rescued and Recycled Silk-ee Spinning Fiber
description:
4+oz of soft, squishy spinning fiber in the my new blend called Recycled Silk-ee. This blend consist of recycled silk thrums, dyed rescued alpaca, and a touch of firestar. The colors in the colorway are lavender, violet alpaca, multicolored silk thrums . I love this fiber spinning it is silk-ee smooth and the resulting yarn is next to skin soft.

This fiber is suitable for most projects including spinning. Fiber is not superwash and needs special care. Handwash in tepid water and lay flat to dry.

name: Maine Morning Headwarmer
description:
An delightful, textured and cabled headwarmer/headband for the when the weather gets a bit nippy. I was inspired to create this mixture of stitches for the days when I decide to go cross-country skiing but get too hot with a hat.

As this pattern only took about 70 yards of yarn I think small amounts of handspun would work wonderfully with this project.

name: Naughty Newbie Spinners Club
description:
Have you or your crafty loved one coveted the idea of spinning yarn but feel a bit lost. The Naughty Newbie Spinners Club is the answer.  We will send you the supplies you need as well as one-on-one training over Skype to get you started on your fiber journey. 

You will receive a drop spindle (the age old spinning tool) with 8 oz of fluffy, delicious fiber prepared 2 ways as well as a questionnaire telling me what you hope to create. In addition to materials you also will receive 2 60 minute sessions with me. In the first session we will go over spindling basics so you can begin creating your own yarn. The second session will be about different ways to ply your lovely singles. 

You will receive a questionnaire via email after purchase along with a gift certificate to print for your loved one. 

IMPORTANT NOTE: if you are buying this as a gift please put the shipping e-mail in the notes at time of purchase.

Normal Price $130.00 Club Price $110.00 (20.00 off)

Clubs are available from September 15, 2013 to December 24, 2013. First shipments will  be sent out January 15, 2014. All ensuing shipments will be sent out on the 15th of each month.

Disclaimer: The colors shown are different than the Clubs, as club colors are dyed exclusively.

name: The Yummiest Yarn Club
description:
For absolute yarn fanatics, The Yummiest Yarn Club combines our Vegan Yarn Club and our Luxury Yarn Club for 6 months of delicious knitterly goodness. 

We will begin with more wintery fibers such as baby alpaca, angora, and long stapled cashmere to protect from the chill in the cold months and then move to more summery fibers such as bamboo, silk, and banana.

If you have an allergy to a fiber please let me know we can substitute a different yarn for you.

Normally Priced $153.59  club price 133.59 ($20.00 off)

Clubs are available from September 15, 2013 to December 24, 2013. First shipments will  be sent out January 15, 2014. All ensuing shipments will be sent out on the 15th of each month.

name: Luxury Yarn Club
description:
Wrap yourself in lavish yarny goodness. We spent months searching and finding some of the softest, long stapled luxury yarns available. All yarns are hand dyed in exclusive, gorgeous color ways just for this club. 

Fibers include baby alpaca, long staple angora or camel or yak (depending on availability) and long stapled cashmere.  You will receive a new yarn delivered to your door every month for three months.


Price $87.76  10% off regular price

IMPORTANT NOTE: if you are buying this as a gift please put the shipping e-mail in the notes at time of purchase.

name: Vivacious Vegan Yarn Club
description:
The yarn club for all vivacious vegan knitters and crocheters. Enjoy your plant fibers to your hearts content. Have a new yarn sent to your doorway every month in amazing exclusive colorways just for this club. 

Fibers are plant based with the exception of peace silk. Peace silk is silk yarn created from discarded silk worm cocoons. Therefore no silk worms or moths are harmed.  If you would prefer another option please let me know. Yarns in this club include but are not limited to banana, bamboo, peace silk, linen and soy. You will receive a new skein of yarn every month for 3 months.

(peace silk picture is undyed I wanted you to see the texture of the yarn)
Price 66.08 12% off

description:
Slip your tootsies into these sumptuous yarns. There is nothing like a pair of scrumptious hand knit socks. Gorgeous color ways hand dyed for this club only. A different yarn sent to you every month. 

 For three months you get a hand dyed color way and pattern specifically for this club.  We will have differing types of sock yarn, including basic sock yarn, metallics for a bit of glitz and the coveted cashmere sock yarn for extra luxury for the tootsies.

name: Sensual Spinning Club
description:
Delight your sensual side with luxury spinning fibers. Amazing recycled silks, rescued angora and alpaca put together in unexpected ways. Some batts will spin into a beautiful silky yarn others will be funky textured art batts. Every batt is one of kind. 

These incredible spinning batts are part local corriedale, part recycled silks and also part rescued fiber animal fibers (a cause near and dear to my heart).
An awesome gift for the spinner or felter in your life! 

You will receive a new 4+ oz batt of fiber for 3 months. Fibers will include but not be limited to Corriedale wool, recycled silk thrums, recycled pulled silk, rescued alpaca, rescued angora, and firestar (for a bit of glam).

description:
Spin your way to summer with our Spicy Spinning Club. A beautiful bounty of fluffy soft spinning fiber sent right to your door.  A spinners delight! The colors are offered in repeatable color ways  ( in case you wish to do something sexy crazy like spin a sweater) 

Our spicy spinning club batts will contain corriedale wool, firestar  (for a bit of glam) , and mohair ( if you require a mohair free option let me know and we can use alpaca fiber instead).
 

You will receive 4+ oz of gorgeous spinning fiber sent to your door for 3 or 6 months depending on your preference. 
What a terrific gift for the crafty character in your life!

name: Serenade Crochet Scarf
description:
This lovely pattern is a compilation of the first fiber art I learned and my OCD tendencies that both sides of the scarf should look the same.
Hence,This scarf is started from the middle, you will create two sides and graft them in the middle. This will make the ends of the scarf look exactly the same from both sides.

That said this wonderful lacy pattern is lovely for spring and summer.

name: Distant Thunder Pacem Serico Lana Yarn
description:
I thought this exotic yarn needed an exotic name Pacem Serico Lana (said pachem se-riko lan-na) means literally Peace Silk Wool. Which happens to be the make-up of the amazing yarn. In moody shades of silver grey this is some of the softest most beautiful silk/wool blend I have found to date. Handspun in a bulky weight it has a springy loft, and buttery softness, with that beautiful silk sheen.

You will get 105 yards, 5+ oz of this lovely yarn.

name: Kara Hand Dyed Peace Silk
description:
I am absolutely thrilled to bring this 100% peace silk, handspun  yarn to you. Peace silk is crazy soft, has the sheen of regular silk without any damage to the little silk worms, with this type of silk the silkworms are allowed to hatch and live out their lifespans. The cocoons are then collected, processed and handspun.


100% peace silk, 50 grams, 230 yards, goes between lace and fingering weight

name: Natural Peace Silk
description:
I am absolutely thrilled to bring this 100% peace silk, handspun  yarn to you. Peace silk is crazy soft, has the sheen of regular silk without any damage to the little silk worms, with this type of silk the silkworms are allowed to hatch and live out their lifespans. The cocoons are then collected, processed and handspun.

name: Nimbly Navajo Plying
description:
Ply the way Navajo Indians do .....without having a leftover bobbin of yarn. You only need one strand of spun yarn to create a gorgoeus 3-ply yarn. We all know that 3 plies are stronger than one ply.Spinning yarn is fun and worth effort.

Navajo Plying is:

- very portable you only need your spindle and a spun single to create this yarn

- thrifty, you will neverdeal with leftover yarns as the yarn is all plied

- adaptable you can navajo ply with either a wheel or spindle

- artistic, as you can create striping yarns using this method as the yarn plies on itself

 
Why should I take this class:  I agree that YouTube and DVDs are a great way to learn a new hobby. I even have tutorials out there. There are missing elements that you cannot get from either of these media and they are direct feedback and insightful explanation.  Its also significantly more fun with two.

Important: basic spinning skills are a must with this class..... you should be able to spin a single. You must also be able to video chat on skype for this class.

Fantastic Features:

- after purchase  I will email you with questionnaire  so I can tailor a plan for your personal needs or you can download it here.

- a 60 minute online lesson with me over Skype, at your convenience

- personal one-on-one instruction with a former teacher who has spent years learning about fibers and teaching spinning to people from age 2 to 92.

- follow up to make sure you are doing as well as you would like

- freedom to e-mail me at anytime with questions, I answer all e-mail within 24 hours.

description:
An opps batt is a beautiful blunder, I started out trying to create one item but came out with something else which seems to happen every now and again when hand dyeing. This opps batt is a blend of corriedale wool, mohair and firestar, just like my basic blend spinning fiber batts. These batts are unique and usually 2 of a kind (as I dye two of the same dyelot at the same time).

This fiber will felt beautifully. It is suitable for most projects including spinning. Fiber is not superwash and needs special care. Handwash in tepid water and lay flat to dry

We are a small farm in rural Maine. I was able to bring my love of animals and fiber together. Most of the animals are rescues. I've found them thru word of mouth and ads. I work with my local shelters to provide foster and permanent homes for these animals. My philosophy is "We have engineered many of our domesticated species that they cannot live without us, therefore we are responsible for them."

I will do custom orders of fiber blends and colors. I am also willing to spin your favorite colorway for you. Just Ask!

name: Nebula - superwash spinning fiber
description:
4+oz of soft, squishy spinning fiber in the Nebula colorway. This is Brandi's Basic Blend of 70% superwash corriedale wool, 20% mohair, and 10% firestar. The colors in this spinning fiber are blend of dark purple,  woodrose, and undyed shiny firestar.  It is lovely lofty, fibery spinning goodness.

This is superwash fiber it will not felt. This means that it can go into the washer and dryer.  I usually wash on gentle and tumble dry on the lower heat setting just as a precaution. Superwash is good for a variety of projects from sweaters to afghans.

We are a small farm in rural Maine. I was able to bring my love of animals and fiber together. Most of the animals are rescues. I've found them thru word of mouth and ads. name: Combed Angora
description:
I just got a wonderful batch of lovely plucked and combed angora from the Bunnies. I don't clip during the winter unless I am forced to because clipping leaves less fiber for their warmth.

3 of our fiber resues have offered up their fibers for your spinning pleasure.  Pictured fibers belong to Bella, Little Girl, and Blue.

Staple lengths run as follows:

Bella - 3 to 4 inches, creamy white with blacks and browns mixed in
Little Girl - 4 to 5 inches  Fawn color
Blue - 4 to 5 inches Thunderstorm cloud colors

This fiber will felt beautifully. It is suitable for most projects including spinning. Fiber is not superwash and needs special care. Handwash in tepid water and lay flat to dry.

name: Semi-precious Knitting Counter Bracelets
description:
Agates, jades, fossil and more semiprecious stones in your knitting counter bracelets for your knitterly sensibilities.There are decorative beads on each end either handblown glass or  handmade pottery beads (with the exception of the fossile and pink that has hemotite decorative beads). There is a handmade tag/charm. The Slide for the counter is made of stretchy band and seed beads in cordinating colors. The clasp is an easy to use lobster clasp with extender for many wrist sizes.

My dear friend Wendy loves playing with beads and making jewelry. I finally talked her into making stitch markers and bracelets. She having blast coming up with new ways and new materials to make them. We have worked together to try to give your the best product possible. I test all her items and we tweak them to make the items both beautiful, functional, and durable.

name: Dusky Purples Silk Blank - Spinning Fiber
description:
This silk blank is dyed with differing shades of purple from red grape to deep violet. The fiber is dyed so that there will be short color changes and it will be a more of a tonal yarn than a variegated one.

1 7/8 oz 

If you have any questions on how to spin silk blanks check out this tutorial or feel free to email me at brandischoch@thefiberofmybeing.net
 http://www.thefiberofmybeing.net/2012/10/spinning-silk-blanks/


This fiber is 100% silk. I find it fine to gently handwash silk items(as this is how I set the twist in the yarn) but you can always dry clean or dryel your finished object if you prefer.

They are unique, meaning that each one has a variety of different fibers. This particular bump is made up of corriedale wool, shetland wool, rescued angora fiber, and coopworth wool. Take your spinning to a new plane. Enjoy the soft, fibery goodness. 4+ oz.

This fiber will felt beautifully. It is suitable for most projects. Fiber is not superwash and needs special care. Handwash in tepid water and lay flat to dry.

We are a small farm in rural Maine. I was able to bring my love of animals and fiber together. Most of the animals are rescues. I've found them thru word of mouth and ads. I work with my local shelters to provide foster and permanent homes for these animals. My philosophy is "We have engineered many of our domesticated species that they cannot live without us, therefore we are responsible for them."

name: Deliriously, Delightful, Drop Spindling
description:
Hear yea, Hear yea, Drop everything!.... Just kidding! However if you have been fascinated with the idea of designing your own yarn you may want grab a drop spindle and get spinning.
 
Have you been enchanted by thoughts of creating your own yarns like they did in days gone by? Does your heart pound  and your stomach flutter when you see colorful braids, batts, or even raw fleece?  Do you wonder about the possibilities?

Wonder no longer because the possibilies are endless. Whether you wish to make traditional wool or silk yarn or you prefer dryer lint and cottonballs. All fibers can be spun! Spinning yarn may take some time but the results are well worth the effort.

Deliriously,Delightful Drop Spindling is a basic spinning course to get your started to creating your own exclusive yarn.

Advantages of creating your own yarny goodness include:

- no more frustration of finding the right color but wrong weight of yarn for a project

- no expensive equipment to buy

- no more boring waits a the DMV you can spindle while you wait .....There is a caveat however with this one ...you may draw and crowd and they will ask questions.

- no more limitations on fibers you can spin whatever you want however thick you want


Important note you must be able to skype to take part in the class.


Why should I take a class there's YouTube/DVDs?

I agree that YouTube and DVD's are a great way to learn a new hobby. I even have tutorials out there. There are missing elements that you cannot get from either of these media and they are direct feedback and insightful explanation.  It's also significantly more fun with two.

Other benefits of  Drop Spindling:

- it's super portable

- it's a great way to start out without the cost of a spinning wheel

- it's a great conversation starter

- it's  perfect for times when you have to wait.....I can sit in the dentist's office for hours if I have my spinning( refer to DVM caveat above).

- it's a way to connect with tradition ....people have been spinning for hundreds of years

What you get from this class:

- after purchase  I will email you with questionnaire  so I can tailor a plan for your personal needs or you can download it here.

- a 60 minute online lesson with me over Skype, at your convenience

- supplies are available if needed, I will mail them to you prior to our session.

- personal one-on-one instruction with a former teacher who has spent years learning about fibers and teaching spinning to people from age 2 to 92.

- freedom to e-mail me at anytime with questions, I answer all e-mail within 24 hours.

 

 

The Basic Spindling kit includes 4+ oz of any basic blend colorway, and your choice of light, medium or dark stained spindle.

The colorways from top to bottom , left to right are Moody, Morning Fog, Peach Nebula, Redwood, Sea Mist, Sherbert, Solar Flare , and Gaia.

Shipping is included in price for kits.

name: Plying 2-3-4 and more
description:
Here's to awesomely regular plying  "Hip Hip Hurray!" Plying can be an art in itself depending what your trying to accomplish. Do you want a lovely lacy 2-ply for a shawl or a tighly twisted 3-ply for hardwearing socks? I've even plied up to 12 plies to make an awesome macrame cord. 

Another reason regular plying can be interesting is due to how colors go together. Do you want a certain color to take center stage while the others around it play a supporting role?  

Spinning fiber into yarn and getting the yarn you want can be an adventure in it's own right whether you are wanting something specific or wanting to see what happens with particular colors.

Benefits:
      - plying can be fun
      - plying makes yarn stronger
      - plying can define a yarn to show stitch pattern better
      - plying can also make a yarn feel open  and lacier (is that a word?)

      - there are no plying police you really can't do it wrong (wish we could say the same thing about parking) 

Important note you must be able to skype to take part in the class.

name: Fabulous Fiber Studies
description:
Youve seen that luscious,velvety,  I wanna roll in it fleece.your fiber porn. You had to have it. But now that you have it.. what heck do you do with it?

Do you dream of creating your own fantastic, ready to spin fiber? Are you confused about how to prepare fibers for spinning? or perhaps how to prepare  a special fiber? You have questions. You keep asking yourself: Am I going to ruin it? Am I being too rough with it? Will it felt into an unspinnable mess? You dont want to learn thru trial and error. You want to do it right the first time. Making your own luscious spinning fiber does take a bit of time but it is well worth the effort.

Thats why I would love to share what I have learned so you dont felt a beautiful silvery grey lincoln fleece, or matt that stupendous suri. The Fiber Prep course will show you:

- how to scour  (the fibery term for washing) your fleece. 
- how to dry your precious. 
- how to  pick, flick, card or comb your fiber into a spinners nirvana. 
- how to work with elementary tools, which means there are NO high ticket items to buy 
- how to find the tools you need if you have grabby hands and want equipment or a special fiber 



What you can expect:

- after purchase download the Fabulous Fiber Studies Questionnaire  so I can tailor a plan for your personal needs 
- 90 minutes of online instruction with me over skype (can be broken down into 2  45 min. sessions) 
- follow up after instruction to help with any difficulties you may run into during your fiber frenzy 
- to be able to ask questions anytime, Im happy to help, just email me , I answer all email within 24 hours
-shipping cost for supplies is included in price(if you choose the w/supplies option)

 Why should you take this course:

- to save yourself time, there is alot of information out there but sifting thru it can take foreveah 
- to get feedback , you could watch videos and dvds but they dont allow for a responsive person to talk to 
- to save money by processing properly the first time, less waste 
- to receive instruction from a former teacher who has spent years perfecting and learning about different types of fiber 
Note: Skype and a webcam are required to take part in this class.

name: Whimsical Wheel Spinning - wool spinning class
description:
I've been fascinated by spinning wheels ever since I was 7 yrs old and saw my first picture of a spinning wheel while reading Sleeping Beauty.Wool spinning was a dream of mine.

A spinning wheel offers a traditional ,but quicker way, to make lots of wonderfully scrumptious yarn.

You may have started as a drop spindle spinner or maybe decided to go for broke and start with a wheel. 

Benefits:

- you can make much more yarn in less time than with a drop spindle

- You are joining a tradition that has gone on for since before the 11th Century

- you can make the yarn you want weight, color etc.

- you will develop a spinning rhythm that can create a calmness
(spinning can be almost meditative)

-you can think of your skeins of yarn as a finished product


and lastly.....You have no limitations on what fiber you want to spin even it's dryer lint and cottonballs.


 
Important note you must be able to skype to take part in the class.


Why should I take a class there's YouTube/DVDs?

I agree that YouTube and DVD's are a great way to learn a new hobby. I even have tutorials out there. There are missing elements that you cannot get from either of these media and they are direct feedback and insightful explanation.  It's also significantly more fun with two.

What you get from this class:

- personal one-on-one instruction with a former teacher who has spent years learning about fibers and teaching spinning to people from age 2 to 92.

name: Advantageous Andean Plying - Making your spinning wool stronger
description:
Ever wonder about the mystery  of Andean Plying?..... If you've ever seen this strange magic, you probably saw  someone wrap a single around their hand in a funny way......... and then make a lovely 2-ply with drop spindle with the single coming off ......... without getting tangled....... and you thought "how the heck did they do that?"


I had these thoughts and it took me a few, frustrating  tries to understand the magic (mechanics) of andean plying.  Then to actually implement this ability was another thing entirely. I wish to save you from the frustration experience I had when learning this skill. Plying can be the most fun of spinning wool.


Benefits of andean plying:

- you need no extra equipment, your spindle and singles are all that you need
- you will never deal with leftover yarns as the yarn is all plied
- you can make a nicely balanced 2-ply with this method
- you can make plied yarn is stronger than a single
- you can andean ply with either a wheel or spindle



Why should I take this class:  I agree that YouTube and DVDs are a great way to learn a new hobby. I even have tutorials out there. There are missing elements that you cannot get from either of these media and they are direct feedback and insightful explanation.  Its also significantly more fun with two.

Important: basic spinning skills are a must with this class..... you should be able to spin a single. You must also be able to video chat on skype for this class.


Fantastic Features:

- after purchase  I will email you with questionnaire  so I can tailor a plan for your personal needs or you can download it here.

- a 60 minute online lesson with me over Skype, at your convenience

- personal one-on-one instruction with a former teacher who has spent years learning about fibers and teaching spinning to people from age 2 to 92.

- follow up to make sure you are doing as well as you would like

- freedom to e-mail me at anytime with questions, I answer all e-mail within 24 hours.

name: Cabled Star Hat
description:
I had this crazy idea that I wanted to create a hat with a 5 point star in cables. After a bunch of trial and error this is the result. A cabled hat that divides and rejoins to make a perfectly even 5 point star.

 Hat is made with size 9 dpns and 125 yards of bulky yarn. In testing it was discoved that a child's size could be obtained with size 5 needles and worsted weight yarn.



You will need Adobe to read this pattern it can be downloaded for free(www.adobe.com). If you wish a hard copy it can be mailed to you for an additional 2.00.
